newsitem.title: USA: Cognizant Corp to post $5.4 mln Q1 gain.
newsitem.headline: Cognizant Corp to post $5.4 mln Q1 gain.

text.p: Cognizant Corp said Wednesday it will post a $5.4 million pre-tax gain in the first quarter 1997 from the sale of WEFA Group Inc, an economics database company that was acquired in August 1994.
The company said the gain would be incremental to first quarter earnings and that it plans to monetize additional Cognizant properties this year.

WEFA Group was an investment of Information Partners, a venture capital fund in which Cognizant Enterprises, Cognizant's in-house venture capital business, is a limited partner. WEFA was recently sold to Primark Corp.

Westport, Connecticut-based Cognizant is an information and technology services company whose principal units are Nielsen Media Research, IMS, which offers information solutions to the healthcare and pharmaceutical industries and a majority interest in Gartner Group, a provider of research and advisory services to the information technology industry.
